intro: Acer italum subsp. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish maple, is a deciduous tree native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, featuring a rounded crown and smooth, gray bark. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a bright green upper surface and a lighter underside, turning vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by samaras that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas across southern Europe.
